p: Infectious diseases are also a concern for wildlife conservation, particularly those already threatened by habitat loss and exploitation. Surveillance of wild animals for infection or disease commonly involves trapping or killing animals for direct sampling of blood and tissues. This can be difficult, expensive, dangerous and sometime unethical. The technique demonstrated here is not only applicable to RRV reservoir identification but also to other arboviruses and infectious agents which have complex transmission cycles and a range of vertebrate hosts.
